title: Vine - overwrite account associated with email via android application

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

It's possible to deny any user from logging in to his account by overwriting the password associated with his email. This is not an account takeover because while we do override the password associated with that specific mail we just login to a "new" account and not the user's original one.

Steps to reproduce:
===
1) Create first account via Vine for android with the mail firstaccountmail@gmail.com with the password Bla123
2) You can now see that you can login to the account created above.
3) Go and create another account - this time with a different password and with the mail Firstaccountmail@gmail.com - notice the CAPS (you can put the caps everywhere on the mail).
4) Finish the creation process - and see that it succeeds
5) Now go back and try to login with firstaccountmail@gmail.com and the password Bla123 and see that you can't. However, it's possible to login with firstaccountmail@gmail.com and the second password you have created - but you"ll login to the second created account.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

It's possible to deny any user from logging in to his account by overwriting the password associated with his email. This is not an account takeover because while we do override the password associated with that specific mail we just login to a "new" account and not the user's original one.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create first account via Vine for android with the mail firstaccountmail@gmail.com with the password Bla123
2) You can now see that you can login to the account created above.
3) Go and create another account - this time with a different password and with the mail Firstaccountmail@gmail.com - notice the CAPS (you can put the caps everywhere on the mail).
4) Finish the creation process - and see that it succeeds
5) Now go back and try to login with firstaccountmail@gmail.com and the password Bla123 and see that you can't. However, it's possible to login with firstaccountmail@gmail.com and the second password you have created - but you"ll login to the second created account.

activities.message: It might be more severe than I first thought - since if the user requests to reset the password it resets the password for the newly created account - meaning he can never recover his old data, And since this issue doesn't require any user interaction this can mean an attacker can "erase" ALL of Vine's users very quickly.

activities.message: Just another final note to help you investigate: it seems to work only if the first account didn't confirm his email.

activities.message:
Hey, 
May I ask why such a low payout? This vulnerability could have caused the erasing of a lot of vine accounts, I think for example that it is much more severe than https://hackerone.com/reports/185862. Furthermore vine doesn't require email confirmation so I believe most of the accounts aren't confirmed and this vulnerability requires no user interaction, so I will be glad if you could explain.

activities.message:
Hi @mishre,
This was determined to be a low severity bug and paid accordingly. The issue you reported only affects accounts that have not done email confirmation. Furthermore the account credentials can be reclaimed by the user with the email. Keeping those in mind we determined it was a low severity bug. 

As for the report 185862, it exposed GPS information which is non public information, accordingly the reward was determined. 

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Well, I have mentioned in the previous comments that the original account cannot be reclaimed(when recovering we reset the password of the new account). Also, Vine by default doesn't require verification upon registration, and does not by default send a confirmation email, so I believe it makes it more severe than you believe it is. 

Thanks for the bounty anyway.

summaries.content: A logic issue in the Vine signup flow allowed a user to create a new account that would be associated with a user’s email, which could result in the user being unable to access their original account.
summaries.content_html: A logic issue in the Vine signup flow allowed a user to create a new account that would be associated with a user’s email, which could result in the user being unable to access their original account.
